review: The food was good and so was our service. The waitress gave me a great recommendation and so I ordered the madlove burger. It was delicious and the bottomless fries were fantastic.  The only downside was I thought this place was a little bit pricey.

Horrible service and even worse food. This is one of my all time worse places I've ever eaten at. We were a group of six. Four adults and two kids. I don't plan on ever eating at any Red Robin anywhere. Yeah, it was that bad! When we were seated, I had to brush the seat cushion off just to sit down. This should've been my clue that we should just turn around and leave. First the good, then the bad. The shakes were good and the side salad was cold, crisp and the dressing was tasty. Tower of onion rings were ok. They were warm'ish but we didn't have any napkins, silverware or plates. We ended up getting our own napkins so we could eat the onion rings. Yep, that's it for the good. When our meals came we had to ask for silverware. Some of our food was warm but nothing was hot.  Deep fried pickles. Gross. They were dripping with grease and then they weren't even warm. Fries weren't fresh and tasted like they had been sitting for awhile. The worst food was the kids meal grilled chicken. My granddaughter ate a couple of pieces and said it tasted bad. We smelled it and you could obviously tell it was spoiled chicken. We had our server smell it and she agreed it smelled terrible. She brought mac and cheese as a replacement. Bad chicken can KILL YOU. It's not as simple as just getting another meal. By this time, I had pretty much had it. Both the grandkids were crying about what a terrible experience this was. We were celebrating our grandson's birthday so it was so sad. This is the Reader's Digest version of this horrible restaurant but you get the idea. I will never go back here to eat. It was the worst experience.

This is a good and safe burger joint. They changed up the decor a little since I've been there, fun for kids though, especially with plane and go cart hanging from the ceiling. Don't go there is you want to have a conversation with group of people because it gets noisy. Ordered the guacamole burger. Toppings were evenly laid out and burger was well done. Great sweet potato fries and yes they still serve bottomless regular steak fries. They are generous with the shakes because they give you the shake with toppings and the second cup half full.

I used to go to Red Robin ALL THE TIME! The food has always been decent and at some times amazing! Good service and everything was good! But the past two times I've dined there were it for me. One of the times I ordered a water and as I was drinking it I noticed little things floating in the water, I looked closer and noticed there was remnants of a shake in there, there was still pieces of ice cream floating around in the cup and on the side of the cup. I just figured it was a little mishap and ignored it and just didn't drink the rest of the water.  I came back again a few months later to give them another chance, and sure enough my water comes to the table, I start drinking it, and about halfway through I noticed what had to be pieces of olives floating in my water! Soggy black chunks in my water! I was super grossed out and paid for my meal and left. Not going back.

I Love me some Red Robin! The Southern Charm is out of this world good. The Boss Hog is amazing. The whisky BBQ and the bonsai are a close second. I eat here at least once a week... Very well organized, food is always cooked  perfectly. They have a full service bar with a variety of cocktails and beer to top your meal off. The customer service is as good as it gets, especially if you have the pleasure of being served by Callie. She is an exceptional server and Bar Tender, depending on the night.

I have been to this location a number of times.  I am not sure why I don't go more, but I can't seem to place this in the five star location.   First is what I like.  the food is good, I like the atmosphere, and the servers are really nice.  I do miss a few items off the menu that they have removed, and a few that they added were not as good as what came off, but oh well.  I got the smoke and pepper burger.  It was ok, nothing great, and did not taste like pepper at all.  That was a big downer because that is what the burger was known for.  Other than that it was like what I could get at home.  The downside of this place.  Crap, way to crowded.  In the section I was in they need to pull a table.  Seriously folks, if I am at the resteraunt don't make me have to move so people and waiters can get by.  Don't make the walkways so tight that it is a tricky walk for people to walk behind me.   On another note I am not sure why we had two big plastic catsups at our table, and at the one next to us, and next to that.   Pros: Clean, nice staff.  Cons:  Food is ok, not sure if it is as good as the price, too crowded with tables.

So disappointing as I just moved here for school from Hawai'i. We dont have a red robins and going to red robins whether it be Utah or California has normally been a good experience. However our table was all the way in corner looks like the kid section on a non busy friday afternoon, our table was not clean, plates were dirty, I asked the hostess to sweep under our table as it was outrageously dirty crayons and food everywhere! She took a while but eventually came over and swept although not very well. Will never come to this red robins ever again and if you are thinking about coming to this location please don't! You will be thoroughly dissatisfied as well. The only plus side is we were fortunate enough to have a really nice waitress!

My first time here! I always walked passed this establishment and I finally got to try it! Where I'm from Hawaii Red Robin is so far away 1hr 45mins one way. Anyways when I first arrived the host greeted us and asked how many is in my party. I came with a party of three and was told the wait would be 15mins. While we waited we just walked around the mall. When we got seated our waiter "not sure his name" but he introduced himself and asked what we would like to drink. We immediately knew he was from Australia because the way he talked. We talked for a while about Australia and how we have family in Sydney. We loved his vibes and attitude! We ordered our food and waited for about 15 mins. He continued to check on us despite how busy it was. My overall experience was good, it just like any other burger place.

Of course the food here is awesome, but the customer service is great too! We ordered an Oreo shake and it tasted a little funky... we didn't want to be those people, but we told our waitress and they were SO nice about it. The took it back and made us a new one that tasted great. Our waitress Callie was so sweet and kept reminding us how important it was to provide good quality food to their customers! 5/5 on service.

This was by far the best Red Robin ever. Luis was the best server. Fries when we were seated. Perfect attention to detail. The burger was to my exacting specifications. Sauces to keep me happy. I could not ask for a better experience. Thank you!

Walked in with my family on Sunday ( this may be part of the problem)    1. We where not given the option the large open         Patio- it just seemed like a nuisance to seat us          there w/ our huge party of 4. -   2. After waiting 10 minutes we finally got a waiter         Which is really not a big deal cause I love the           extensive menu. +/-   3.  Asked for a Guinness in a non chilled glass got           a can Guinness with chilled glass. Oh well            I should know better than to go to a              Restaurant in Provo on Sunday much less              Order alcohol.   4.  The waiter was so damn grumpy I though            Someone may have punched his Mother or             Girlfriend (see above Sunday in Prove) hell it               felt like we had sat down in his house and                we were an intrusion 5.   Corporation is tightening belt or sumpin            Buns on all items where greasy and second              rate unlike the old ones nothing was cooked              to order                 now come in a metal container limiting                  the amount and "bottomless" LMAO the                   server just avoided us until he came over                     and asked about Dessert                    grudgingly he took the Dessert order and                     left. I cleared dirty dishes after he                       Slapped down the Dessert and left. I                         placed them on the table next to us                           where I took the absent fry spice                             from that was not on the table or                              fries  6. All food was mediocre and smaller in quality         S'more expensive though.  The only reason I did not give one star is because the food is palatable and I have been going to one RR or another for over 20 years with good memories. Uncharacteristic of me I gave the waiter less than 10% which is the Provo norm.  To bad for him as I tip fat for good or even mediocre service it's a good thing he got that Dessert order in- what a putz. I will avoid this RR for ever more and go to others w/ low expectations if forced.

We went for dinner tonight and had a wonderful experience! We were greeted by two managers when we came in, James and Rachel, both of whom continued to check up on us during the evening. Our server, Carlos, was pretty slammed, but he checked on us as often as possible given the number of people he was waiting on and was quite pleasant. The food was great, we especially loved our milkshake (cookie magic with strawberries mixed in). My order was right the first time which was awesome cause I made lots of adjustments to it. All in all, a very good experience and we will definitely come back at some point.

Terrible service. Kept telling us that we would be seated in 10 minutes and never did. After waiting for over an hour we finally had to give up. Other people with groups our size were seated ahead of us. A wasted trip and my son didn't get to go to the place he chose for his birthday dinner.  Avoid this location!!

Didn't have high expectations as our friends took us here. It isn't a restaurant I would choose but my wife ordered the Black and Blue Burger which was dry and over cooked. Anytime you order a burger and they don't ask you, 'How do you want that cooked?' just know it's coming out well done. For a place that prides itself on burgers you would think it would allow you to have rare and medium prep as an option. I got the nachos which were decent but overall, I give it a 2.5 out of 5.

Food was awful and slow. Half of our table got their burgers but one person waited an additional 20 minutes for a basic cheese burger. Ice tea had no ice...twice. Fries cold. Lots of open tables but still a 15 minute wait. Floor covered with food and trashed and so greasy on the tile that I was afraid to slip.  I have no idea why this place has to be so horrible. It's as if they go out of their way to be bad.

I know it's not kosher to rate chains high among yelpers, but this place is my guilty pleasure. I love to come here and get the Red's Tavern Burger, which runs at under $8, and get one or two extra servings of fries with their bottomless fry deal. The fry sauce has a BBQ tinge to it here that I really love. The lemonades aren't bad and the service has been adequate. Most of the stuff on the menu is probably not quite worth the price, but if you work it like I do then it's a good experience.

Red Robin is good--most options are obviously burgers so be aware. We went on a Friday night around 8:00pm, the wait was 45 minutes for a party of two. Thankfully the bar was open, so we walked right up and ordered and ate our food there, disputes only drinking water. The service at the bar was quick compared to the rest of the restaurant, but because it was so busy the service was a little chaotic and still took a while. We never got a refill on our bottomless fries (or even offered a refill...) and it took 10+ minutes to get the check, and another 5+ for a to-go box. Typical mass restaurant chain quality when it comes to the food.

We were there last night, it was 80 degree outside we wanted to sit on the patio we were told we couldn't because they didn't have a server outside. They puts us next to the window looking at the patio our server couldn't have walked outside maybe 10 ft to the table on the patio.  The customer service isn't high on the totem pole at Red Robin. It was cold inside they gave us a brand new server that forgot everything but she tried to make up for it. I spent $60 for 2 people including a tip, I would have probably spent more if they would have let us sit on the patio in a more comfortable setting.

We went here for lunch today- there were 10 of us. We told hostess she could split up party to seat us faster. They had  PLENTY of empty tables. Hostess seemed disinterested and inattentive. After standing around for about 12 minutes in the empty lobby we left and walked over to restaurant next door. Need to train your staff better.

I was visiting Provo last week while my Dodgers were in the NLCS. My hotel room didn't have the game's broadcast, so I searched for a restaurant with some TV's. I've always enjoyed Red Robin, so decided to give it a shot. I asked to be sat in front of a TV playing the Dodger's game. I was along and expected to be sat at a bar or a small table. Instead, they sat me at a table for four people. However, it was perfectly pointed right at a TV with the game playing. My server (I think his name was Blake) took my order, but his first question was whether the view was good. I ordered a burger with bottomless fries and root beer float. I warned him that I was planning on sticking around a while, and he had to objection to the idea. The burger was great, as always. The fries kept coming and coming, as promised. As did the root beer floats. I don't think I finished a single one without another one appearing in front of me. I cheered on my team and witnessed one of the best games I've ever seen in my life!! Blake kept coming around and asking if I wanted more food, and to see how my team was going. Not once did I feel rushed to leave. Even after I over-did my stay, the bottomless foods kept coming until I told them to stop in fear of me exploding. Whenever I think of Red Robin, I've always thought about their wonderful service. I think only once I received mediocre service, but it has otherwise been spot on and exceeded expectations. I love their seasoning, I've purchased them before at a decent price. I love using them on burgers and fries.
Fries is the thing to get here. The dipping sauce they have are spicy ketch up, buffalo fry sauce and ranch sauce, they all taste so good!

I went at 7 and they told us it was an hour wait -- which is understandable -- we were seated about 45 minutes later!  Our waitress (was very friendly and warned us that they were super busy but she would do the best she could. It took us a little while to decide what we wanted but she checked on us every few minutes. She was very attentive and brought us new drinks when ours were getting low. I got the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Sandwich (9.99) and my boyfriend got the Crab Cake Burger (14.39).  It took about 15-20 minutes for our food to come out!  My boyfriend was raving about his crab sandwich and mine was very delicious as well!! Both sandwiches were very filling too.  I wouldn't go here if you're in a hurry! But it's a great atmosphere for a date night, girls night or family dinner!!  Tip: if you get a burger, you get bottomless fries too!
Insanely noisy.  Terrible service.  Half empty and they asked me to sit at the dirty bar because I'm by myself.  Terrible place!

Not good. I ordered the burning love burger and it was bland and boring. My wife got the house salad and it with old rotten cucumbers. She told the waiter but we were still charged for it. 2 stars cause the fries and sauce were decent.

Don't get suckered into spending an extra $3 for the "Big Tavern"! According to our waiter it's actually the same amount of meat as the Tavern Double, just with one bigger patty instead of two smaller ones.

Went to this Red Robin last night. (It was a Friday night about 8 pm) We waited 30 minutes for my husband and I to get seated which was fine, but our server was not friendly. She did not seem to want to be there and had a bad attitude until the end when she tried to make conversation for a tip. She acted put off when we asked for water or something. The food was not good either. Normally I love Red Robin, but the fish was bland, chicken strips were so dry and hard, and our fries were hard. On top of that, I ordered the freckled lemonade and it had literally 1 strawberry and 3 ice cubes. I know they were busy and usually give people the benefit of the doubt but the food and service was just not up to par tonight.

I ended up spending $20 here for a very average meal and a terrible waiter. He was very sarcastic and rude. I'm usually very satisfied with Red Robin but I would say that if you're going to go, choose a different location.
As always, burgers were great! Service was decent and hey - full bar selection which is rare around here!

Worst freaking Red Robin in the entire world. Every time I eat here, no matter what day of the week or what time, I have the slowest and worst service ever known to man. Out with my coworkers and the waiter spilled fry sauce all over one of the guys, and they didn't even comp his food! The food is fine, but there is MUCH better food around where you don't have to put up with this kind of slow, inconsistent, attention-lacking service. Go somewhere else.

OMG, a simple average size family waiting nearly an hour for a table while several other families were seated before ours.  Absurd.  Almost went across the way to Wingers but their food could choke a goat.  Finally got a table now how long do we wait for the food.  I could be in a diabetic coma by the time we get some service around here. My step daughter's hand is stuck to the table in someone else's leftovers.  Disgusting but after waiting so long ... Leaving is out of the question.  I'll now be reaching out to google and consumer  . All my posts are positive but such a distasteful experience deserves noting.  Pick it up Red Robin in Provo, UT.

Red Robin has really good burgers. I got the tavern double and it was cooked perfectly and moist and delicious. They have bottomless fries with bbq fry sauce. The service is good and quick. They have lots of options like wraps and salads too. I really like Red Robin. Yum!
Here we go again.   Why can't servers fill my soda?  Maybe it's because he dumped a whole platter of like 5 sodas on my wife.  Our food was cold but not because of the sodas.   Poor service tonight.

I have always had a great experience here. Food is quick and great for the price. This past time our server Blake was on point and did an amazing job. My wife and I were really impressed at everything. We will definitely be back!

This is the second year our BMW group has had a lunch meet here and we were not disappointed either time. The manager (Victor) was VERY accommodating and patient in getting us all (30 folks) in the same section. Not only were he and his staff simply amazing but the food was excellent. We WILL continue to make this a yearly meeting place. I would like to personally thank Victor and his staff, you made the day! Thank you so much. Jackie L. Clark

This red robin is the slowest one we have ever been to. They are always busy but refuse to take reservations. You will get there around dinner time and ask for a table and they will say 30 to 45 min. And it will take them a hour and 10 to be seated.  When you ask them for more fries. Or for fries while you wait for your food, they make it a huge fuss every time and tell you some excuse like "our kitchen is behind today" or "I can see what I can do" aka they will maybe bring you a basket with 10 fries to split. And they are usually slow about bringing them out. People come for the fries. If they were smart, they would be prepared with extra fries. I have been to 6 or 7 different red robins and have never had a problem.  I had gotten a bacon cheese burger with guacamole and asked for no tomato or lettuce. It came out with both, when I asked them to fix it they took it in the back and when they brought it back to me you could clearly tell they just took it in the back and took them off to bring back to me(against health code) and then also most of my guacamole was scraped off my burger. It's a joke there.  The only reason I give it two stars is because they have good food like all red robins. Or else I would give them 1 star. They make it seem like they would rather get you in and out but can't seem to do it. It's probably the worst red robin I have ever been to.
Endless strawberry lemonade? Can you say six glasses!!!

Honestly one of the worst experiences my family has had at a restaurant. Our waiter was chatting it up with another table and gave little to no attention to us. Management didn't even seem to care. When another table asked for his help he said "this ain't Burger King, you can't have it your way". While I'm sure he was just trying to be witty and charming, it was came off very rude. Aside from poor service, the food quality was very bad. It all tasted as if it had been sitting out for days and my daughters grilled cheese wasn't even cooked. Also-the restaurant was very dusty and dirty. Not one to usually leave bad reviews, but the combination of all of these things set us over the edge. We didn't even finish our food, we wanted out of there so bad.

Wonderful experience. My husband and I went on a busy Saturday night, but got seated in 20 minutes even though they said the wait would be 30. Our waiter, Tanner, was quick to fill up our bottomless fries and never missed a beat when it came to keeping our waters full. My Southern burger (brown sugar- coated beef patty, honey bbq sauce, candied bacon, etc.) was to die for. The Monster-size Oreo milkshake at the end was perfect for us to share. Great date night experience!

This is probably my favorite as far as the large, national chain sit-down burger joints are concerned. The fact that everyone who comes in practically has bottomless steak fries is both great and terrible; great because they are so damn good, and terrible because of the health factor that goes into the risk of bottomless steak fries. I've been to this specific location multiple times, and the staff has always been great! Super friendly and really gets to know the people who they are serving. Many of the servers have been here for 2+ years, so I'm sure management must be doing something right! I've never been unhappy with the food, and I usually get the chicken strips or the garden burger- both are done really well! If you want a fun treat, I'd definitely recommend getting a speckled lemonade while you are here! It's tasty, refreshing, and definitely a fun way to dress up your meal!

Normally I really like Red Robin but our experience last night wasn't that great.  We ordered two burgers and my wife got a raspberry cream soda. We also ordered onion rings with our burgers. When our meal came out, they gave my wife the wrong drink, there were no onion rings, and the bun my burger was in crumbled in my hands. Plus the table we were on felt like it was in the middle of a walkway.  The food tasted ok but the experience was pretty bad. I'd give this a lower rating only if the food was bad but these guys need to step up their game.

I love this place. The fries are good so are the burgers... And you can get really creative with what you order. I LOVE the cookie milkshake so freaking tasty. You'll need to work out after you eat here haha but the servers are super friendly too. Make sure you have a more full bottle of their signature blend seasoning because of it's almost empty the smoke flavor falls to the bottom and it isn't as good/mixed well. Salads.... Not their forte... So wouldn't recommend those here... If you want one don't waste your money... Just get a side salad.

It's a very noisy location and can get pretty crazy on the weekends but overall is a good social place, the waiters are not annoying they give you your space and the food is consistently well prepared and I always leave satisfied for a fair price. Two thumbs up to Red Robin.

Normally Red Robin isn't bad, but as me and my husband are sitting here right now eating this is the worst job they have ever done for us service wise. Waitress did not write down our order then after a longer than normal wait brought out our food. My husband's burger was wrong, and i was brought a burger despite ordering chicken. Then when attempting to correct my husband's food they brought it out now missing ingredients. Just did not seem like she was listening and did not take any notes to go off of, then had a very off-put attitude. Food itself, mac and cheese would not order again. It was just a bowl of oiled or buttered noodles with a pile of partially melted cheese in the middle. Whiskey river chicken sandwich the crispy onions and bun was soggy making it hard to eat, but overall taste was fine. My husband royal red burger once fixed was good but the egg was overdone and a bit greasy. Chocolate Malt was delicious. My husband was disappointed with bottomless fries because our waitress never returned so he could get more than his initial serving. Eventually anouther waiter brought us our check so we could leave.
Great restaurant! Good service and great food. The thing I like most is that they under promise and over deliver!

The wait was really long for our group of 8. The appetizer we ordered were chips and salsa and when it arrived there was only about 4 huge chips on the plate. The service was good, we had a really nice waiter.  I like their food, I just dislike their long wait times!!

We were told the wait to get a table would be 10-15 minutes; after 25 minutes we asked how much longer it would be and were told 10-15 more minutes with 3 names ahead of us. Right at the same time 3 other people were told that they had 3 names ahead of them. We ended up waiting about 35 minutes. Once we had our table, our visit was fine, and food was great. But we were in a time crunch and had to eat really quickly. If we had been told we would be waiting 35 minutes we would have gone somewhere else and not been so worried about time. Wait staff here is very kind and helpful, but the hosting staff needs to be honest when telling customers how long they will be waiting.

The fries today are amazing! It's good to try something new. The cod burger is actually very good. It is the equivalent of fish and chips in a sandwich.   You can't really go wrong there. 4 stars only because the wait was a little longer than normal

we walk in to the establishment to be greeted with what sounded like a thousand screaming children. the music was loud and horrible. every single table was either flooded with sunlight or pitch black. i nearly tripped on my way over to my seat, but luckily the sticky floor made it easy to keep my footing. the hosts and servers were smug and smelly. the air was cold. me and my fat polar bear wife were freezing our H-E-double toothpicks off. we came for the "bottomless fries" that we had heard so much about. we ordered a burger and fries and the food arrives in about 45 minutes. meanwhile the television is showing D-League basketball in crappy resolution. i felt like i was in the waiting room at a jiffy lube. our waiter was visibly sweaty and muttering obscenities under his breath. he was extremely out of shape and judgmental. even more than my wife. he came to us with our food and proceeded to couch on it and give a pathetic smile and mumble as an apology. then he coughed on it again. he stumbled away awkwardly and kicked a veteran's shattered knee on his way to the kitchen. naturally we started inspecting the food. they put mustard on it. we scarfed down the fries like the rabid animals we are. and now we were waiting for our refill of the BOTTOMLESS fries. IT NEVER CAME. my wife was angry. so naturally we started yelling at each other. then the waiter came back spilled a malt on my bare foot. and i have some pretty big feet, mind you. i barked at the waiter and demanded a refund. he demanded pension. it was a standoff. it may as well have been high noon. i had his pension and he had refill. "where are my fries?" i demanded my fries. he responded by saying "i'm already is." no lie. the fries are apparently bottomless because the three inch tin they come in has no bottom. i am on nine prescription medications. in summary i dont like red robin and i dont like the american dream. hope this review helps.
Was not impressed with the food or the service. I've come here several times now and it's the same "mehh" every time. Rather spend my hard earned money elsewhere. It's a chain, what can you expect?

After reading the other reviews, I was ready for the worst, but it was pretty good. We waited about 30 minutes on a Saturday lunch. Our order came quickly and our waitress was very nice. We didn't go for the expensive burgers (maybe next time). The burgers were decent, not the best. The really good part was the bottomless steak fries and sweet potato fries. And the fry sauce is addictive.  My family loved it, so we'll probably go again.

The Provo store is a JOKE , 4pm on a Wednesday afternoon we waited 38 minutes and my fish & chips was cold . Later they asked if I wanted more fries , in which I did , they brought about 7 fries and said they didn't have any more cooked up . So I'm guessing there not going to make anymore today ? They need to string the manager up . I will be going to a soup kitchen from now on before I go to the movies .

When living in Utah Valley, this was a go to place for my husband and I. We went so often that a waitress recognized us and our order. When we went it wasn't crowded and we were seated right away. We always got fries in advance and our food was always hot, correct, and delicious!

Red robin is good no matter where you go. We were seated right after (right before the dinner rush) and when we asked to switch to a booth, they gladly moved us right away. Our waiter was awesome. He was really quirky and brought us fries out right after we ordered instead of waiting until our food came out. He also brought out a bunch of different sauces for us to try with the fries. Their ranch is my favorite still. My husband got a wisky burger which he always gets. I tried the Damn Good Burger (D.G.B.) for the first time and it was absolutely amazing. I will get that every time from now on. We will be back!

We have been (and still are) fans of Red Robin; this Provo location is not exceptionally bad, but rather consistently mediocre and moderately bad in the several visits we have had.  We lived in Las Vegas (actually Henderson) for 5 years and there were two locations nearby us, one that was always great, the food would come out hot and well prepared, service was generally good, and then there was the other location (like the Provo location).  We would intentionally drive the extra 5-10 min to the better location, unfortunately we do not have that option in Provo. As this has been our experience, tonight will probably be the last time we visit this location.  I had the new überburger (that doesn't even compare to the Oktoberfest burger a few years ago) and my wife had the smoke and pepper burger - both of our sandwiches were room temperature, the fries were cool, and worst of all flavor was boring.  This has been our experience here the last few times as previously mentioned. Wait times here are atrocious, 15-20 minutes waiting to be seated, then another 22 minutes to get our cooled down food (I started a timer on my phone the moment we placed the order).  Two times ago we actually watched other people get seated, order food, get their food, and one table finished before our food came (we had a different waiter than the tables we were watching). Hope that helps anyone wondering what to go eat tonight!

location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: My family and I went here for dinner. We were seated quickly and sat for several minutes before our waiter even greeted us. There were multiple tables that were empty when we sat down, but filled up shortly after. It was obvious that the other waiters cared about their tables, as they were attended to in a prompt manner.  We placed our order when our waiter brought our drinks out, and sat, and sat, and sat. All of the tables around ours received their food prior to ours, and they had ordered after we did! It literally took 25 minutes to receive our food and our waiter blamed it on the fact that my wife ordered a gluten-free item. "It takes longer as we have to clean the spatulas, etc...". Haha...nice try. Tell that to our children who were hungry, crying and impatient.  Unfortunately, we will most likely not return. If you want prompt service and a good experience, there are definitely better choices.
I'm not a fan of their burgers. I've tried 5 burgers so far and they all seem bland and just mediocre in flavor. The steak fries are good though, and it usually has good service!

I ordered the A-1 burger and jump start appetizer, my son ordered the pig out tavern double.  The onion rings and cheese sticks were 4 star as always.  Sad to say that is where the stars stopped.  My son's burger was fine and his fries were hot.   My burger really lacked the fine food aspect.  The bun was so dry it was hard.  It was literally inedible.  The fries were old, cold and hollow inside.   Such a shame as they usually have some of the best fries.  They offered me a bun, but I was halfway eating my patty with a fork and was not going to pay to assemble my own food.  The server was great and tried to help, but we never got a visit from the manager with apologies, even though it was a real slow time and place was practically empty.  They only gave me a $3 discount for a meal I could barely consume.  Sad to say it is no longer a place on my favorite list.  Sadly lacking in management and cooking skills.

Food was great! I had their new Black & Blue burger. I would have that for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and second dinner. Do it if I were you. My 3 star rating is for the poor service. Had to ask for more fries, had to ask to refill our drinks, had to make conversation with the server. The dude had no personality. Made for a boring atmosphere, total opposite of the restaurant's theme. Good food...service kinda off night. "More fries please!"

They've recently raised their prices and made the portions small. Example: there used to a deal where you could get a cheeseburger and all-you-can-eat fries for only $5. It's now up to $7. You used to be able to order a milkshake AND also get the leftover in a tin can for $3. It's now been raised to $4.50.  My real complaint, though, is that I recently ordered the Red's Tavern Double. The menu says it's made of "classic-sized" patties. I took that to mean Red Robin classic size. Nope! Their Tavern Double is as small as McDonald's double cheeseburger...except you're paying 3 times the amount. My burger was literally less than half the size of everyone else's at the table. I felt the menu was very misleading. All I can say is that Red Robin is definitely going downhill.

I have had mostly great and some lesser experiences at this Red Robin. We love the burgers here and the bottomless fries are my personal favorite. I usually over eat greatly every time but you can hardly blame the restaurant for that.  There's a nice selection of burgers and I only dislike two so far. Service has been at times unexpectedly wonderful and sometimes lacking. This RR location is one of the better locations I have visited.
One of our favorite places! The burgers are always perfect, the fries just keep coming, and when we are lucky enough to have Derek as a waiter it's like the cherry on top!
Not impressed.   The service is crap!  A table full of people and only 1 person has a full drink.

Don't come here when it is busy. We came on a Saturday. They told us it was a 40 minute wait, so we walked around the mall and came back. We checked to make sure we hadn't been missed and then sat down to wait. After waiting a total of 1 hr and 15 minutes, we explained out situation and asked how much longer it would be. They informed us it would be an additional 30 minutes. We did not want to wait almost triple the original time they said it would take, so we left. If you can actually get a table, the food is okay.

Red Robin is not too bad. They have a decent selection and I love the steak fries. I am not a fan of the new menu. They have good drinks and the floats are not bad either. They are ridiculously crowded on weekends. The hamburgers are not as good as they boast. I usually get grilled chicken.

I love Red Robin. I've always had. If i need a burger or fries fix, I tend to choose this palce over many other burger joints, because it's cheap, its fast, it's friendly, and the bottomless fries are hard to pass. Lots of different types of burgers, and sandwiches, are an attractive element to this place, as you can come and always try something new. I've tried most of the burgers, and I must say I think I like the royale best. Go getcha sum mmm mmmm goood beeerger thurrr... It's delish. and being the franchise that it is, you won't be surprised at something by going to another location.
Had a great dinner with my wife at red robin.  Devin, the server was very attentive and even gave us fries at no charge because we had to wait a little longer than usual.

Waited 45 minutes for the 3 of us to be seated. Ordered a burger with no mayo, got a burger with mayo anyway. Sent it back and they came back with the same burger having scraped (most of) the mayo off the top bun. They didn't even bother to scrape it off the bacon. Red Robin food is great, but I will not be eating at this location again.
Don't go. Just don't.  Food is only flavored with grease and salt. Selection is limited if you don't want burgers. The malts are the only redeeming aspect of Red Robin.

I'm a firm believer in forgiveness and redemption. Nobody is perfect. It's not about never making any mistakes. It's about making things right when you do. The management staff were very apologetic and eager to make it right and on my visit this time, everything went smoothly. They got every order right and were quick and prompt with service. Thanks to Daisy and Tyson for handling this so professionally.

I had a very bad experience here the other day. I usually don't do this kind of stuff but the service was so exceptionally horrible I feel the need to say something. The food was fantastic, it always is, but our server (Marc was his name if you are unlucky enough to get him) was horrendous. He seemed like he would rather be anywhere else on Earth than serving us. We came in and asked for fries as an appetizer. He acted like there was a shortage of fries on planet Earth and he just had a baby that could only eat fries. He actually said to us "If I get around to it." And "I'll try." After asking him four times, we asked him what his deal was and he explained to us that there was a new policy put into place restricting servers from bringing guests fries before they get their Entree. What? We asked for a manager (But not before getting some major sass from this Marc guy) and she explained to us that there was no such policy and she apologized for our waiters bad/lazy attitude. We mentioned we come to Red Robin often and probably wouldn't go out of our way to return in the future and Marc said "I don't care. Fine by me." We left him a tip and I hope he uses it to pay for some acting classes so he can at least pretend to care about a guest.  The food is fantastic; Marc made me feel bad. Get the Royal Robin with a side of their cute lady manager but only ask for fries if you're willing to pull some of the waiter's teeth.
This place totally redeemed it's self.  The service today was excellent!!

I have been to this Red Robin probably 20 times and have had excellent service and food nearly every time. You just can't go wrong with their burgers and bottomless fries. My lady loves the clucks and fries and orders it nearly every time. Overall, I love this place and am glad there is something to eat in south Provo.
Red robin is one of my favorite restaurants! They have delicious food and usually their service is great! I usually go the Provo one and as long as you get a good server, you will enjoy it!
Great server. Great menu, plus  a hardcore allergy menu. But, pretty normal food. Fun atmosphere.

I waited over an hour for them too seat my party and I, even though there was a party the same size that showed up after us and were seated before us. They also do not take reservations unlike most restaurants in the area. Once inside the service is good though.

Great service! We had to wait for some friends who were 45 minutes late, our server was completely chill and even brought us complimentary fries while we waited. I love their French onion soup and bottomless sweet potato fries. Inexpensive and tasty, servers are always friendly and will bring you extra bottomless fries to take home with you if you want. The food came really quickly, and there was plenty of it. We never get appetisers when we come here because they give you plenty of food, so we always leave full with a box of food to take home.
Great service, burger , and endless fries. The server was attentive and kept the fries and Lemmon aid  coming I think I may need a Togo box and Wheelbarrow :)

I've never had a juicy, not overly salted burger here.  And now that Winger's is offering all-you-can-eat fries too, and is usually less busy, I probably won't be back.  (Also, I admit, I'm biased for Winger's since I've worked there.  But I can share my love, right?  Still, I can't get on the RR bandwagon.  Just not juicy or flavorful enough for me).

It's been a long time since I've eaten at a red robin. Not as good as I remember. The service was good and the people were nice but the burger was, meh. I asked for extra pickles, as usual with my burger. First two bites, I couldn't taste any pickle. I opened the bun to see an entire layer of micro shave pickles, then I noticed the tomatoes and onions were also about 1/16th of an inch thick. The flavour that stood out the most, bun. But the steak fries were very good. Not the Red Robin Burger I used to have with a screaming red zombie back in the day.

I feel the service is pretty good and accommodating to allergies where they can. They are polite. We LOVE getting the sweet potato fries. I like their gluten-free hamburger buns.  They aren't too dry and they fit the patty well. I like the freckled lemonade.

I stopped in here on a business trip on 1/7/13.  The food was decent.  I actually had the same exact meal at another Red Robin in south Denver.  The food here was not as good as the other location.  Also, the service was not as good.  There were a couple instances where I waited for drink refills where I did not have to do that at the other location.   The personality of our waitress was also a little creepy.  It was just weird.  If I'm ever in the area again, don't count on me visiting this place again.

BEST fries ever!!! And I've seriously loved everything I've tried there, even things I typically wouldn't branch out to try. Tons of options if you aren't going for a burger! Service has always been fantastic too! Felt like I was an important customer!

Red Robin has been a stand by for me since my wild and wooly single days. Laid back comfortable enviornment and good burgers. This is my favorite burger chain. My burger of choice: A1 Peppercorn with onion rings instead of fries dipped in Red's patented fry sauce.
We went to red robin last week as a family and really had a good time.  The food was yummy.  It was super busy and the poor server had to keep saying sorry for not getting food and refills out to us.

Let me preface my review by saying that I love Red Robin. I think the food is great, affordable, and it's probably one of my favorite places to eat. I have noticed that some of the reviews mention the servers being stingy with fries. I think a lot of us in our jobs tend to get put out and annoyed by things just because they become monotonous and we get sick of doing them every day. I would assume that this is how bottomless fries are for Red Robin servers. That being said, if you're tired of getting fries for customers, don't work at Red Robin. Not one time have I asked for fries at this location and had a server say, "sure", or, "yes". It's always something to the effect of, "I'll try", or, "I'll go see." It's your job. Get me my fries. It cannot be that hard. The food is great. The service? Meh.

My husband and I have been to this Red Robin twice in the last few weeks and it's been amazing every time.  The servers are prompt and watch the level of your beverages and fries really well.  The food is amazing too.  We both had a burger and were both satisfied.  The staff is really friendly and very accommodating.  We will be going back!

The service here is terrible.  My order has always been screwed up and have to wait another good 30 minutes to get it right. Doesn't matter if we wait to get seated or get seated right away, it will always take forever to get your food. We once had a waiter give himself a bigger tip and the management did nothing about it.

Love red robin food and my kids are crazy about it. The value is poor for the cost but we keep going back, guess that should say something. My biggest complaint is that am frequently told to wait in the lobby when there are visibly a DOZEN or more empty tables. Someone told me it's a function of the available wait staff but whatever. If I have to sit somewhere please let it be a booth instead of the awful lobby corral.

Took over 40 minutes to get a turkey sandwich, which they placed under the hot lamp. All of the veggies were limp; not fresh since they were cooked under the lamp, and the fries were hard (like a raw potato).  The manager came and apologized and stated he felt bad about the delay and offered to give us a discount, but it was never applied to our receipt.  The server was great, but the food was disgusting and over-priced (which is saying a lot as it only cost about $9 per dinner).  I would not recommend this place to anyone. BAIT & SWITCH: As for their "bottom-less Fries"- they serve you about 5-10 fries at a time, but only if you ask for them and only if you want to wait. In fact, the server never returned to fulfill on this 'offer'.

Love this place.  It's not really as convenient as going to other fast food places.  But, like many others have stated, it's a terrific place.  I too love their frys.  I think sometimes they could be a bit more generous with the refills, but just keep'em coming and I'll  be happy.  The restaurant is a bit loud, but it doesn't  keep me from coming  back.

In my opinion, the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap is the one thing that separates Red Robin's from the countless other dime-a-dozen burger peddlers out there. It sticks out from that humdrum menu like a sore (but tasty) thumb. There used to be two other outstanding menu items: The Carnitas burger, and the Baja turkey club. But these mysteriously disappeared from the menu a few months back. When we asked the waitperson about this, she gesticulated in an animated fashion and expressed that she had been surprised to see those go; they had apparently been quite popular. Bah. The Nuclear Iced Tea is also quite nice if you fancy a strong cocktail.

Did you ever want fast food but want to pay more and wait longer for it? If so, this is your place. They offer some very different burgers, but the quality of the meat is actually lower than some fast food chains.  (Carl's Jr, Inn-N-Out, and Wendy's)

Red Robin is my favorite place to eat in the East Bay area of Provo. But what I really want to talk about is the "Sweet Jim Beam Bacon Swiss Burger." My favorite burger ever! I don't know if they still have them there, it might have been a temporary menu item. If so bring it back. It is a delicious burger.

Now I normally don't review chain restaurants.  There are two reasons for that.  First of all, you should know what to expect when you walk into a chain.  The food will be the same.  The decor will be (mostly) the same.  The only thing that really varies is the service.  So there isn't much to be said that you shouldn't already know before you walk in the door.  The second reason is more personal bias.  I don't like eating at chain restaurants and do so only when I really don't have much other choice.  I fully encourage everyone to support locally owned and operated restaurants whenever possible.   So why am I reviewing this Red Robin then?  Because I told myself I would review all the restaurants I ate at on this trip, and I intend to stay true to that intention.  With that said, here we go. Service:  5/5 We arrived early in the afternoon on a Wednesday and we had the place entirely to ourselves.  The hostess greeted us promptly, we were seated right away, and served quickly.  They explained some of the new items on the menu to us, as well as currently running specials.  Overall we had nothing to complain about in terms of the service.   Food:  3/5 Ok, I'll be honest here.  There was nothing WRONG with the food, it's just very pedestrian.  They claim their burgers are something spectacular, but frankly I've had much better burgers at a lot of different places.  We had a queso dip appetizer and it also was just very average.  In my opinion, it is a little bit overpriced as well.  The food simply isn't as good as they claim it should be, or what they charge for it.  At the end of the day, it is simply average all the way around. Overall Impressions:  4/5 The restaurant was clean, well maintained, and the decor was nice.  I'm not really into the whole "50's retro" look.  Frankly it doesn't really match up with their menu in my opinion.  If they are going for the old "burger stand" vibe, the menu is a little too fancy for that.  Am I splitting hairs?  Yeah.  Why?  Because I'm biased against chain restaurants.  Hey, at least I'm honest about it. So why do they only get  three stars overall?  Well, Yelp says that at four stars "I'm a fan."  I'm not a fan.  If you need a burger and this place is there, you'll get a decent one.  But I would encourage you to find someplace better.

Good food, Great service and a fun dining atmosphere. Its funny the item I like the best was their Fry Sauce. I know it's fry sauce but NOT your normal fry sauce. it had a strong  barbecue flavor that i've only tasted one other time. You won't be blown away when you eat here but you will enjoy it

For good burgers, sandwiches, milkshakes and fries Red Robin is great. I like the comfortable booths, cool decorations, and fun atmosphere. Staff is usually friendly and prompt with refills and more fries. Being Provo there tends to be a lot of families with kids at Red Robin and sometimes whinnying, crying kids can be an annoyance but overall I like this Red Robin.
Service sucked tonight! What's the deal? It's never been this bad. Our server acted surprised that we actually wanted refills. Disappointed :( The burgers were great though.
4 stars now, quality is still pretty good, waiting time has decreased over the last few months. What used to be 45 min wait, is now down to a max of 15 min
Factory food, average service, very loud and cramped seating - I can't think of a reason to return for another meal.

Okay, I decided that this place isn't so bad... when you're in the mood for that kind of place. And my wife and I were a couple days ago. So, even though we thought we probably wouldn't ever go back again, here we were. Learning from our mistakes however, we avoided the Friday night rush and the ciabatta bread. I got the burnin' love burger with a raspberry lemonade (which was surprisingly good). I still think the portion sizes are a too big -- I always walk out feeling like a whale and I don't want to drive home, but my wife makes me. Anyway it's not like the burgers make for good leftovers, so what you don't finish gets thrown away, and I hate throwing away food, so it's always a dilemma (idk, maybe that doesn't make sense to anyone). But all in all, it really hit the spot this time. So, four stars.
Good food, family-friendly atmosphere. Best full-service place for burgers.
Best cheese sticks in the world.  They have this great movie deal for $33.  You get two movie passes to cinemark, free mozzarella sticks, and $20 to spend on food.  Great deal.  Good food.

Awesome food and awesome service. Red Robin is the go-to spot for my friends and I. This location is always filled with tons of college students, which I'm sure is sometimes hard on the servers, but they never show it. Even if we have a large group all on separate checks, requesting drink refills and every sauce imaginable, we still get excellent and speedy service. A fun environment too, and they even have gluten-free options for one of my best friends!

They have a good selection of burgers with a lot of varieties. They've all tasted good, you can customize burgers to mix and match. I enjoy the freckled lemonades and milkshakes, a little pricey though.  The bottomless fries are refills, not free appetizers. I can eat as many fries as i can fit, so no complaints with that.  The fried zucchini is probably my favorite thing on the menu, but the other reviewer was right about the royal burger (except for the chicken part).  Service is usually good, not otherworldly but that's from someone who goes somewhere to eat and not be entertained and socialize.

We only went there because we got a gift card as a present.  I got the fish and chips.  The fish was mushy.  Costco fish sticks would have been better.  There were literally five french fries in the basket.  The tower of onion rings as an appetizer was good.  I also ordered a chocolate shake.  I got a chocolate malt.  The presentation was great, but it tasted like hershey syrup.  Not all that great.  Overall, just a step above Sonic, charging three times as much.
Good burgers, but best of all are the bottomless fries and their unique fry sauce! I think they use BBQ sauce in it.

Another Chain. I swear that is all I go to anymore. I find that every Red Robin I go to is pretty much the same. I do want to say, don't get the sour cream ranch chicken burger. It wasn't that special, there are so many better options. My favorite is to get the Royal burger with chicken instead of beef, truly amazing! Also remember to ask for honey mustard with the fries and ask for some fries while you're waiting for the meal to come out.

I've been to Red Robin several times in Provo, and each time it has pretty much been the same. Nothing too exceptional, but good enough to keep me coming back. Unfortunately, I decided to go on Martin Luther King, Jr. Day when the teeny high school kids decided to linger at the mall all day while the snow poured down. The place was packed, but we were seated rather quickly. The service was good at best. I waited a good 20 minutes for my Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap. The wrap was good, but not as good as expected. I'll likely order it again, but not before I order a classic Red Robin Cheeseburger. The endless steak fries really make the trip, especially with their fry seasoning and some ranch dressing. If you choose to go with a dessert, I definitely recommend the Mile High Mud Pie. Definitely meant for more than one person, this thing is so good. And overall the price of Red Robin isn't poor at all.
We love the whiskey river bbq wrap. Soooo good! Add the Rookie Magic shake to it and you'll be golden. Take my recommendation!

Food is good, however service is so-so. We ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burgers, Cheese Sticks, Coke and a Raspberry Ice Tea. Burgers were good, cheese sticks were ok, but came with a very small serving of marinara sauce. The waitress however came over with a Dr. Pepper on the refill round instead of a Coke... They're nice but not very attentive, just a quick check and they're gone. Not a bad experience in general, hence a 3 star instead of 2. And price range is $$ rather than $.

Yeah four stars seems a little ridiculous, but the place has been great whenever I have gone. Unlike some of the reviews I've read. I must just have gotten lucky, but in the 5-6 times I have been the service has been pretty dang good, including offering to refill fries plenty. Because there is nothing that is hands down amazing on the menu for the price, I would say 3.5 stars. But I had to round up. The last time, it was honestly the best service I've ever experienced for less than $15 a plate. And they had a $5 cheese burger special and bottom less fries. Drinks always full, and the manager even got us our fries before the food came. Unexpected, but good. The food has always been consistently good. Good shakes, good burgers. Lives up to the price I'd say, and so far it has been consistent.

I have had consistent mediocre service and food.  My biggest complaint is that you have to fight for your bottomless fries.  If you ask for some before your meal, you might get them.  You will never get more until your meal arrives.  Seems like the last few times I have been there the food is a little bland.
